name: Demosaicing Artifact Analysis
description: Analyzes color filter array demosaicing artifacts to verify camera origin and detect synthetic images.
mechanism: Real camera images exhibit specific demosaicing patterns from Bayer CFA interpolation. This method analyzes inter-channel correlation patterns at pixel level to detect inconsistencies.
parameters: CFA pattern: RGGB, Interpolation: bilinear/AHD/VNG, Correlation window: 5×5, Analysis: cross-channel
source: Popescu, A.C. & Farid, H. (2005) — Exposing Digital Forgeries by Detecting Traces of Demosaicing, ACM IHMMSec
useCase: Verifying camera sensor origin by checking CFA demosaicing traces in images

references.title: Popescu, A.C. & Farid, H. (2005) — Exposing Digital Forgeries by Detecting Traces of Demosaicing, ACM IHMMSec

strengths:
• Strongly linked to physical sensor
• Difficult to forge convincingly
• Works across camera brands
• Detects both AI and spliced images
limitations:
• Not applicable to RAW images
• Some cameras use non-Bayer patterns
• Heavy post-processing may mask traces
• Requires sufficient spatial resolution
